text: "Stuntin' Like My Daddy" is the first single off of American rappers Birdman and Lil Wayne's collaborative studio album Like Father, Like Son. The song was released on July 18, 2006. There was a rock remix of the song by Travis Barker which was released on October 31, 2006. The song was able to make it to #5 on the Hot Rap Songs, #7 on the Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs, #21 on the Billboard Hot 100, and #31 on the Rhythmic charts. Both the song and ringtone were certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In the song, Birdman and Wayne rap about how they get money. Birdman reps his record label and Wayne also raps about how he is better than other rappers. A music video for the song was released. In the video, Birdman and Wayne's house is getting raided and they escape on motorcycles. After getting chased by a car, they stop at a house and jump into somebody's car. Birdman raps while getting a tattoo and sitting in a room full of money and women. They jump out and run away from the car as a helicopter blows it up. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:2006 songs Category:Lil Wayne songs Category:Hip hop songs
title: Stuntin' Like My Daddy
